The orientation of the part should be straight up in Unity, so the end should point down and the front up.
Before you export your mesh from your modeling program, you have to ensure that the Y-axis of your part is pointed up (it looks like right now your part is oriented on the Z-axis, which is common)

The above comments are correct, but not specifically the reason your part is attaching oddly. Your nodes are defined incorrectly. Depending on how you've made them there are different fixes, but I'm going to assume you used an empty transform in Unity. If that is the case the blue arrow (z axis) should be pointing along the axis you want to use to attach the part.

But the best way is changing the size in the 3D modelling software.
